thread.title: Kincaid’s Honolulu to close later this year with Ward Warehouse demolition
thread.title_full: Kincaid’s Honolulu to close later this year with Ward Warehouse demolition

author: Katie Murar
title: Kincaid’s Honolulu to close later this year with Ward Warehouse demolition

organizations.name: ward warehouse demolition seattle-based restaurants unlimited inc.

text: Seattle-based Restaurants Unlimited Inc. will close down Kincaid's Honolulu in August,… more Tina Yuen Kincaid’s Honolulu, a steak-and-seafood restaurant that has been in business on the second floor of Ward Warehouse for more than 40 years, will close down in August, ahead of demolition to make way for The Howard Hughes Corp.'s next luxury mixed-used condominium project. While Seattle-based Restaurants Unlimited Inc. , plans to keep Ryan’s Grill open at Ward Centre nearby, there are no plans to reopen Kincaid's at another location. Restaurants Unlimited also owned Palomino, a popular downtown restaurant in Honolulu’s Harbor Court that closed in 2007. Seattle-based Restaurants Unlimited Inc. will close down Kincaid's Honolulu in August,… more Tina Yuen “Our current focus is to take care of our team members, many of whom have been with us for decades,” said Restaurants Unlimited CEO Jim Eschweiler said in a statement. "We are coordinating with Kincaid’s Honolulu’s management to provide resources for all team members to mitigate the impact of this difficult situation." The restaurant’s exact closing date is unknown, although the 62 Ward Warehouse tenants have until Aug. 6 to vacate the retail and restaurant complex. The 115,000-square-foot property will be demolished to make way for the Gateway Towers, the newest luxury condominium complex planned by The Howard Hughes Corp. (NYSE: HHC). The two towers will have a total of 236 units and will be designed by famed architect Richard Meier . Katie Murar covers tourism, restaurants, retail and residential real estate for Pacific Business News. Related Content
